questions.question: What type of output does a regression model predict?
questions.explanation: Regression models predict continuous numerical values — such as prices, temperatures, or durations — as opposed to discrete categories.

questions.question: Logistic regression is used for regression tasks despite its name.
questions.explanation: Despite having 'regression' in its name, logistic regression is a classification algorithm. It outputs probabilities and applies a threshold to assign discrete class labels.

questions.question: In a confusion matrix, what does a False Negative (FN) represent?
options: The model correctly predicted a negative case
The model incorrectly predicted a positive case
The model missed a positive case — predicted negative when it was actually positive
The model correctly predicted a positive case
questions.explanation: A False Negative occurs when the model predicts negative but the actual value is positive — it missed a true positive case.

questions.question: If your task is medical screening where missing a disease is very costly, which metric should you prioritize?
questions.explanation: In medical screening, missing a positive case (false negative) is more dangerous than a false alarm. Recall measures the proportion of actual positives that were correctly identified.

questions.question: Mean Squared Error (MSE) penalizes large prediction errors more heavily than Mean Absolute Error (MAE).
questions.explanation: MSE squares the errors, so a prediction that is off by 10 contributes 100 to the error, while MAE would only contribute 10. This makes MSE more sensitive to outliers and large errors.
